definition: square/frame/rule/(legal) case/style/character/standard/pattern/(grammar) case/(classical) to obstruct/to hinder/(classical) to arrive/to come/(classical) to investigate/to study exhaustively
to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: A born non-dualist, he had no faith in a Personal God.
sentences.chinese: 他是一個天生的非人格主義者，不相信人格化的神。

sentences.english: Would he or she be depersonalized, deprived of any possibility ever of developing their own unique sense of identity and personhood?
sentences.chinese: 他或她將被人格化，自己的獨特和人格都被阻礙？

sentences.english: Nature in his novels is personated and melted with the characters together.
sentences.chinese: 在他筆下，自然被人格化了，並和人熔爲一體。

sentences.english: The personify the divine and magic powers worshipped by the people.
sentences.chinese: 它們把人們崇拜的神力和魔力都人格化了。

sentences.english: The personification of the sweet, primeval waters surrounding and supporting the earth.
sentences.chinese: 《巴比倫史詩》中的原始甜水之淵及其人格化形式。

sentences.english: Science is the highest personification of a country.
sentences.chinese: 科學是國家的最高的人格化。

sentences.english: Literary creation is a transformation from non-literary factors to aesthetic personification.
sentences.chinese: 文學創作是非文學因素的審美性人格化轉化。

sentences.english: To the Han Dynasty, the God of Kitchen was anthropomorphized and endowed with new functions.
sentences.chinese: 到了漢代，竈神被人格化，並賦予了新的功能。

sentences.english: Management laborer is the anthropomorphize delegate of advanced productivity.
sentences.chinese: 經營管理勞動者是先進生產力的人格化代表。

sentences.english: "Officer standard" is personification of authority in natural economic.
sentences.chinese: “官本位”是自然經濟關係條件下，權威的人格化。

definition: to assign/to entrust (a task)/to give/to bestow
viral marketing/see also 病毒營銷|病毒营销[bing4 du2 ying2 xiao1]
to refer to/to be used in place of
